benchmark_details.name: Synthesis Step by Step (S3)
benchmark_details.overview: S3 is a data synthesis framework that reduces the distribution gap between synthesized datasets and real-world distributions by iteratively extrapolating the errors of a small model trained on synthesized data, improving data efficiency in training models with limited labeled data.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve data efficiency in training small models by synthesizing high-quality datasets that better match real-world data distributions.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The framework is not stable across different prompts and assumes that the large language model has good knowledge of tasks.

data.source: Synthesized datasets through the S3 framework utilizing large language models.
data.annotation: Automatically generated by the S3 framework.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are evaluated by comparing the performance of the small models trained on synthesized datasets against benchmarks.
methodology.interpretation: Improvements in task performance indicate a successful reduction in the distribution gap.
methodology.baseline_results: Average improvement of 9.48% compared to ZeroGen and 2.73% compared to GoldGen.
methodology.validation: Performance validated through experiments on multiple NLP tasks.
